interface.name: kde_external_brightness_v1
interface.description: Some brightness control mechanisms are somewhat unstable, or require root privileges, so putting them inside of the compositor is not desired. This protocol is for outsourcing the actual brightness-setting to a process outside of the compositor.

description.summary: registers a brightness device with the compositor

interface.name: kde_external_brightness_device_v1
interface.description: After creating this object, the client should issue all relevant setup requests (set_internal, set_edid, set_max_brightness, optionally set_observed_brightness) and finish the sequence with commit. Afterwards, for each change in values, the client must call commit again.

description.summary: destroy the object and unregister the brightness control device
sets whether or not the brightness device belongs to an internal display

arg.name: internal
arg.summary: 1 if it's an internal panel, 0 if not

description.summary: set the EDID data for identification of the display

arg.name: string
arg.summary: base-64 encoded string of the first 128 bytes of the EDID

description.summary: notifies the compositor of the maximum brightness that can be set on this device

arg.name: value
arg.summary: the maximum value that can be set

description.summary: notifies the compositor that all relevant identifiers and values have been sent

event.name: requested_brightness

description.summary: requests the client to change the brightness to this value

event.description: The client must ensure that if the brightness level changes due to external factors, that it either overwrites those changes with what the compositor last requested, or commit again with set_observed_brightness specifying the changed brightness.

arg.name: value
arg.summary: the value to set the device to

request.name: set_observed_brightness

description.summary: notifies the compositor of the brightness that was read from this device

request.description: The client can set this to notify the compositor of the device's initial brightness. It can also set this again after the initial commit to notify the compositor that the brightness level has changed due to external factors. The compositor is free to use or ignore this value as it sees fit.

arg.name: value
arg.summary: the observed value that was read
